member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.AdvancedBackupSetting
member.summary: A list of backup options for each resource type.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.AdvancedBackupSetting.BackupOptions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupOptions.
Specifies the backup option for a selected resource. This option is only available for Windows VSS backup jobs.
Valid values:
Set to "WindowsVSS":"enabled" to enable the WindowsVSS backup option and create a Windows VSS backup.
Set to "WindowsVSS":"disabled" to create a regular backup. The WindowsVSS option is not enabled by default.
If you specify an invalid option, you get an InvalidParameterValueException exception.
For more information about Windows VSS backups, see Creating a VSS-Enabled Windows Backup.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.AdvancedBackupSetting.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
Specifies an object containing resource type and backup options. The only supported resource type is Amazon EC2 instances with Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS). For a CloudFormation example, see the sample CloudFormation template to enable Windows VSS in the Backup User Guide.
Valid values: EC2.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
The account ID that owns the backup job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.BackupJobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupJobId.
Uniquely identifies a request to Backup to back up a resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.BackupOptions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupOptions.
Specifies the backup option for a selected resource. This option is only available for Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backup jobs.
Valid values: Set to "WindowsVSS":"enabled" to enable the WindowsVSS backup option and create a Windows VSS backup. Set to "WindowsVSS":"disabled" to create a regular backup. If you specify an invalid option, you get an InvalidParameterValueException exception.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.BackupSizeInBytes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupSizeInBytes.
The size, in bytes, of a backup.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.BackupType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupType.
Represents the type of backup for a backup job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.BackupVaultArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupVaultArn.
An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.BackupVaultName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupVaultName.
The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.BytesTransferred
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BytesTransferred.
The size in bytes transferred to a backup vault at the time that the job status was queried.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.CompletionDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CompletionDate.
The date and time a job to create a backup job is completed, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CompletionDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.CreatedBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedBy.
Contains identifying information about the creation of a backup job, including the BackupPlanArn, BackupPlanId, BackupPlanVersion, and BackupRuleId of the backup plan used to create it.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.CreationDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationDate.
The date and time a backup job is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.ExpectedCompletionDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExpectedCompletionDate.
The date and time a job to back up resources is expected to be completed, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of ExpectedCompletionDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.IamRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IamRoleArn.
Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point. IAM roles other than the default role must include either AWSBackup or AwsBackup in the role name. For example, arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/AWSBackupRDSAccess. Role names without those strings lack permissions to perform backup jobs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.PercentDone
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PercentDone.
Contains an estimated percentage complete of a job at the time the job status was queried.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.RecoveryPointArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecoveryPointArn.
An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.ResourceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceArn.
An ARN that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
The type of Amazon Web Services resource to be backed up; for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource type is Amazon EC2.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.StartBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartBy.
Specifies the time in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when a backup job must be started before it is canceled. The value is calculated by adding the start window to the scheduled time. So if the scheduled time were 6:00 PM and the start window is 2 hours, the StartBy time would be 8:00 PM on the date specified. The value of StartBy is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.State
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property State.
The current state of a resource recovery point.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupJob.StatusMessage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StatusMessage.
A detailed message explaining the status of the job to back up a resource.

member.summary: Specifies a scheduled task used to back up a selection of resources.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule.CompletionWindowMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CompletionWindowMinutes.
A value in minutes after a backup job is successfully started before it must be completed or it will be canceled by Backup. This value is optional.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule.CopyActions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CopyActions.
An array of CopyAction objects, which contains the details of the copy operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule.EnableContinuousBackup
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EnableContinuousBackup.
Specifies whether Backup creates continuous backups. True causes Backup to create continuous backups capable of point-in-time restore (PITR). False (or not specified) causes Backup to create snapshot backups.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule.Lifecycle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Lifecycle.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold storage.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule.RecoveryPointTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecoveryPointTags.
An array of key-value pair strings that are assigned to resources that are associated with this rule when restored from backup.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule.RuleId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RuleId.
Uniquely identifies a rule that is used to schedule the backup of a selection of resources.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule.RuleName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RuleName.
An optional display name for a backup rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule.ScheduleExpression
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ScheduleExpression.
A cron expression in UTC specifying when Backup initiates a backup job. For more information about cron expressions, see Schedule Expressions for Rules in the Amazon CloudWatch Events User Guide.. Prior to specifying a value for this parameter, we recommend testing your cron expression using one of the many available cron generator and testing tools.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule.StartWindowMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartWindowMinutes.
A value in minutes after a backup is scheduled before a job will be canceled if it doesn't start successfully. This value is optional.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRule.TargetBackupVaultName

The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupRuleInput.Lifecycle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Lifecycle.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup will transition and expire backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold storage.

member.summary:

The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupVaultListMember.CreationDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationDate.
The date and time a resource backup is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupVaultListMember.EncryptionKeyArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionKeyArn.
The server-side encryption key that is used to protect your backups; for example, arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupVaultListMember.LockDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LockDate.
The date and time when Backup Vault Lock configuration becomes immutable, meaning it cannot be changed or deleted.
If you applied Vault Lock to your vault without specifying a lock date, you can change your Vault Lock settings, or delete Vault Lock from the vault entirely, at any time.
This value is in Unix format, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupVaultListMember.Locked
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Locked.
A Boolean value that indicates whether Backup Vault Lock applies to the selected backup vault. If true, Vault Lock prevents delete and update operations on the recovery points in the selected vault.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupVaultListMember.MaxRetentionDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxRetentionDays.
The Backup Vault Lock setting that specifies the maximum retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. If this parameter is not specified, Vault Lock does not enforce a maximum retention period on the recovery points in the vault (allowing indefinite storage).
If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or shorter than the maximum retention period. If the job's retention period is longer than that maximum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or copy job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use a different vault. Recovery points already stored in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupVaultListMember.MinRetentionDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MinRetentionDays.
The Backup Vault Lock setting that specifies the minimum retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. If this parameter is not specified, Vault Lock does not enforce a minimum retention period.
If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or longer than the minimum retention period. If the job's retention period is shorter than that minimum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or copy job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use a different vault. Recovery points already stored in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.BackupVaultListMember.NumberOfRecoveryPoints
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NumberOfRecoveryPoints.
The number of recovery points that are stored in a backup vault.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.CalculatedLifecycle
member.summary:
Contains DeleteAt and MoveToColdStorageAt timestamps, which are used to specify a lifecycle for a recovery point.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold storage.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CalculatedLifecycle.DeleteAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeleteAt.
A timestamp that specifies when to delete a recovery point.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CalculatedLifecycle.MoveToColdStorageAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MoveToColdStorageAt.
A timestamp that specifies when to transition a recovery point to cold storage.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateBackupSelectionRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateBackupSelection operation. Creates a JSON document that specifies a set of resources to assign to a backup plan. Resources can be included by specifying patterns for a ListOfTags and selected Resources.
For example, consider the following patterns:
Resources: "arn:aws:ec2:region:account-id:volume/volume-id"
ConditionKey:"department"
ConditionValue:"finance"
ConditionType:"StringEquals"
ConditionKey:"importance"
ConditionValue:"critical"
ConditionType:"StringEquals"
Using these patterns would back up all Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volumes that are tagged as "department=finance", "importance=critical", in addition to an EBS volume with the specified volume ID.
Resources and conditions are additive in that all resources that match the pattern are selected. This shouldn't be confused with a logical AND, where all conditions must match. The matching patterns are logically put together using the OR operator. In other words, all patterns that match are selected for backup.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateBackupSelectionRequest.BackupPlanId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupPlanId.
Uniquely identifies the backup plan to be associated with the selection of resources.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupSelection.
Specifies the body of a request to assign a set of resources to a backup plan.

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.DeleteBackupVaultLockConfigurationRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteBackupVaultLockConfiguration operation. Deletes Backup Vault Lock from a backup vault specified by a backup vault name.
If the Vault Lock configuration is immutable, then you cannot delete Vault Lock using API operations, and you will receive an InvalidRequestException if you attempt to do so. For more information, see Vault Lock in the Backup Developer Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeBackupJobResponse.StartBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartBy.
Specifies the time in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when a backup job must be started before it is canceled. The value is calculated by adding the start window to the scheduled time. So if the scheduled time were 6:00 PM and the start window is 2 hours, the StartBy time would be 8:00 PM on the date specified. The value of StartBy is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeBackupVaultResponse.EncryptionKeyArn
member.summary:

The server-side encryption key that is used to protect your backups; for example, arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeBackupVaultResponse.LockDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LockDate.
The date and time when Backup Vault Lock configuration cannot be changed or deleted.
If you applied Vault Lock to your vault without specifying a lock date, you can change any of your Vault Lock settings, or delete Vault Lock from the vault entirely, at any time.
This value is in Unix format, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeBackupVaultResponse.Locked
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Locked.
A Boolean that indicates whether Backup Vault Lock is currently protecting the backup vault. True means that Vault Lock causes delete or update operations on the recovery points stored in the vault to fail.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeBackupVaultResponse.MaxRetentionDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxRetentionDays.
The Backup Vault Lock setting that specifies the maximum retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. If this parameter is not specified, Vault Lock does not enforce a maximum retention period on the recovery points in the vault (allowing indefinite storage).
If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or shorter than the maximum retention period. If the job's retention period is longer than that maximum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or copy job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use a different vault. Recovery points already stored in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeBackupVaultResponse.MinRetentionDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MinRetentionDays.
The Backup Vault Lock setting that specifies the minimum retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. If this parameter is not specified, Vault Lock does not enforce a minimum retention period.
If specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or longer than the minimum retention period. If the job's retention period is shorter than that minimum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or copy job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use a different vault. Recovery points already stored in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeBackupVaultResponse.NumberOfRecoveryPoints

The number of recovery points that are stored in a backup vault.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeFrameworkResponse.FrameworkStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FrameworkStatus.
A framework consists of one or more controls. Each control governs a resource, such as backup plans, backup selections, backup vaults, or recovery points. You can also turn Config recording on or off for each resource. The statuses are:
ACTIVE when recording is turned on for all resources governed by the framework.
PARTIALLY_ACTIVE when recording is turned off for at least one resource governed by the framework.
INACTIVE when recording is turned off for all resources governed by the framework.
UNAVAILABLE when Backup is unable to validate recording status at this time.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeFrameworkResponse.IdempotencyToken
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRecoveryPointResponse.Lifecycle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Lifecycle.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups that are transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold storage.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRecoveryPointResponse.RecoveryPointArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecoveryPointArn.
An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRecoveryPointResponse.ResourceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceArn.
An ARN that uniquely identifies a saved resource. The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRecoveryPointResponse.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
The type of Amazon Web Services resource to save as a recovery point; for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRecoveryPointResponse.SourceBackupVaultArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceBackupVaultArn.
An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the source vault where the resource was originally backed up in; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:BackupVault. If the recovery is restored to the same Amazon Web Services account or Region, this value will be null.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRecoveryPointResponse.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
A status code specifying the state of the recovery point.
PARTIAL status indicates Backup could not create the recovery point before the backup window closed. To increase your backup plan window using the API, see UpdateBackupPlan. You can also increase your backup plan window using the Console by choosing and editing your backup plan.
EXPIRED status indicates that the recovery point has exceeded its retention period, but Backup lacks permission or is otherwise unable to delete it. To manually delete these recovery points, see Step 3: Delete the recovery points in the Clean up resources section of Getting started.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRecoveryPointResponse.StatusMessage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StatusMessage.
A status message explaining the reason for the recovery point deletion failure.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRecoveryPointResponse.StorageClass
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StorageClass.
Specifies the storage class of the recovery point. Valid values are WARM or COLD.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRegionSettingsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeRegionSettings operation. Returns the current service opt-in settings for the Region. If service opt-in is enabled for a service, Backup tries to protect that service's resources in this Region, when the resource is included in an on-demand backup or scheduled backup plan. Otherwise, Backup does not try to protect that service's resources in this Region.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRegionSettingsResponse

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.DescribeRegionSettingsResponse.ResourceTypeOptInPreference

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.DisassociateRecoveryPointRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DisassociateRecoveryPoint operation. Deletes the specified continuous backup recovery point from Backup and releases control of that continuous backup to the source service, such as Amazon RDS. The source service will continue to create and retain continuous backups using the lifecycle that you specified in your original backup plan.
Does not support snapshot backup recovery points.

member.summary:

The unique name of an Backup vault.

member.summary:

An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies an Backup recovery point.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.Lifecycle
member.summary:
Contains an array of Transition objects specifying how long in days before a recovery point transitions to cold storage or is deleted.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, on the console, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold storage.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.Lifecycle.DeleteAfterDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeleteAfterDays.
Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is deleted. Must be greater than 90 days plus MoveToColdStorageAfterDays.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.Lifecycle.MoveToColdStorageAfterDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MoveToColdStorageAfterDays.
Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is moved to cold storage.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListBackupJobsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListBackupJobs operation. Returns a list of existing backup jobs for an authenticated account for the last 30 days. For a longer period of time, consider using these monitoring tools.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListBackupJobsRequest.ByAccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ByAccountId.
The account ID to list the jobs from. Returns only backup jobs associated with the specified account ID.
If used from an Organizations management account, passing * returns all jobs across the organization.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListBackupJobsRequest.ByBackupVaultName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ByBackupVaultName.
Returns only backup jobs that will be stored in the specified backup vault. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

Returns only backup jobs that were created after the specified date.

Returns only backup jobs that were created before the specified date.

Returns only backup jobs that match the specified resource Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ListBackupJobsRequest.ByResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ByResourceType.
Returns only backup jobs for the specified resources:
DynamoDB for Amazon DynamoDB
EBS for Amazon Elastic Block Store
EC2 for Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud
EFS for Amazon Elastic File System
RDS for Amazon Relational Database Service
Aurora for Amazon Aurora
Storage Gateway for Storage Gateway

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ProtectedResource.ResourceArn

The type of Amazon Web Services resource; for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource type is Amazon EC2.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultAccessPolicyRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutBackupVaultAccessPolicy operation. Sets a resource-based policy that is used to manage access permissions on the target backup vault. Requires a backup vault name and an access policy document in JSON format.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultAccessPolicyRequest.BackupVaultName

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultAccessPolicyRequest.Policy
member.summary:

The backup vault access policy document in JSON format.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultAccessPolicyResponse

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration operation. Applies Backup Vault Lock to a backup vault, preventing attempts to delete any recovery point stored in or created in a backup vault. Vault Lock also prevents attempts to update the lifecycle policy that controls the retention period of any recovery point currently stored in a backup vault. If specified, Vault Lock enforces a minimum and maximum retention period for future backup and copy jobs that target a backup vault.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationRequest.BackupVaultName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupVaultName.
The Backup Vault Lock configuration that specifies the name of the backup vault it protects.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationRequest.ChangeableForDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChangeableForDays.
The Backup Vault Lock configuration that specifies the number of days before the lock date. For example, setting ChangeableForDays to 30 on Jan. 1, 2022 at 8pm UTC will set the lock date to Jan. 31, 2022 at 8pm UTC.
Backup enforces a 72-hour cooling-off period before Vault Lock takes effect and becomes immutable. Therefore, you must set ChangeableForDays to 3 or greater.
Before the lock date, you can delete Vault Lock from the vault using DeleteBackupVaultLockConfiguration or change the Vault Lock configuration using PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration. On and after the lock date, the Vault Lock becomes immutable and cannot be changed or deleted.
If this parameter is not specified, you can delete Vault Lock from the vault using DeleteBackupVaultLockConfiguration or change the Vault Lock configuration using PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration at any time.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationRequest.MaxRetentionDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxRetentionDays.
The Backup Vault Lock configuration that specifies the maximum retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. This setting can be useful if, for example, your organization's policies require you to destroy certain data after retaining it for four years (1460 days).
If this parameter is not included, Vault Lock does not enforce a maximum retention period on the recovery points in the vault. If this parameter is included without a value, Vault Lock will not enforce a maximum retention period.
If this parameter is specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or shorter than the maximum retention period. If the job's retention period is longer than that maximum retention period, then the vault fails the backup or copy job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use a different vault. Recovery points already saved in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationRequest.MinRetentionDays
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MinRetentionDays.
The Backup Vault Lock configuration that specifies the minimum retention period that the vault retains its recovery points. This setting can be useful if, for example, your organization's policies require you to retain certain data for at least seven years (2555 days).
If this parameter is not specified, Vault Lock will not enforce a minimum retention period.
If this parameter is specified, any backup or copy job to the vault must have a lifecycle policy with a retention period equal to or longer than the minimum retention period. If the job's retention period is shorter than that minimum retention period, then the vault fails that backup or copy job, and you should either modify your lifecycle settings or use a different vault. Recovery points already saved in the vault prior to Vault Lock are not affected.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultNotificationsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutBackupVaultNotifications operation. Turns on notifications on a backup vault for the specified topic and events.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultNotificationsRequest.BackupVaultEvents
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupVaultEvents.
An array of events that indicate the status of jobs to back up resources to the backup vault.
The following events are supported:
BACKUP_JOB_STARTED, BACKUP_JOB_COMPLETED,
COPY_JOB_STARTED, COPY_JOB_SUCCESSFUL, COPY_JOB_FAILED,
RESTORE_JOB_STARTED, RESTORE_JOB_COMPLETED, and RECOVERY_POINT_MODIFIED.
To find failed backup jobs, use BACKUP_JOB_COMPLETED and filter using event metadata.
Other events in the following list are deprecated.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultNotificationsRequest.BackupVaultName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupVaultName.
The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RecoveryPointByBackupVault.LastRestoreTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastRestoreTime.
The date and time a recovery point was last restored, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of LastRestoreTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RecoveryPointByBackupVault.Lifecycle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Lifecycle.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold storage.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RecoveryPointByBackupVault.RecoveryPointArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecoveryPointArn.
An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RecoveryPointByBackupVault.ResourceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceArn.
An ARN that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RecoveryPointByBackupVault.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
The type of Amazon Web Services resource saved as a recovery point; for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database. For Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backups, the only supported resource type is Amazon EC2.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.RecoveryPointByBackupVault.SourceBackupVaultArn
member.summary:

The backup vault where the recovery point was originally copied from. If the recovery point is restored to the same account this value will be null.

member.summary:

The unique name of the S3 bucket that receives your reports.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportDeliveryChannel.S3KeyPrefix
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3KeyPrefix.
The prefix for where Backup Audit Manager delivers your reports to Amazon S3. The prefix is this part of the following path: s3://your-bucket-name/prefix/Backup/us-west-2/year/month/day/report-name. If not specified, there is no prefix.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportDestination
member.summary: Contains information from your report job about your report destination.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportDestination.S3BucketName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3BucketName.
The unique name of the Amazon S3 bucket that receives your reports.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportDestination.S3Keys
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Keys.
The object key that uniquely identifies your reports in your S3 bucket.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportJob
member.summary: Contains detailed information about a report job. A report job compiles a report based on a report plan and publishes it to Amazon S3.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportJob.CompletionTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CompletionTime.
The date and time that a report job is completed, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CompletionTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportJob.CreationTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationTime.
The date and time that a report job is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportJob.ReportDestination
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportDestination.
The S3 bucket name and S3 keys for the destination where the report job publishes the report.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportJob.ReportJobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportJobId.
The identifier for a report job. A unique, randomly generated, Unicode, UTF-8 encoded string that is at most 1,024 bytes long. Report job IDs cannot be edited.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportJob.ReportPlanArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportPlanArn.
An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportJob.ReportTemplate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportTemplate.
Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using a report template. The report templates are:
RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportJob.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of a report job. The statuses are:
CREATED | RUNNING | COMPLETED | FAILED
COMPLETED means that the report is available for your review at your designated destination. If the status is FAILED, review the StatusMessage for the reason.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportJob.StatusMessage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StatusMessage.
A message explaining the status of the report job.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportPlan

member.summary:

The date and time that a report plan is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportPlan.DeploymentStatus
member.summary:

The deployment status of a report plan. The statuses are:
CREATE_IN_PROGRESS | UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS | DELETE_IN_PROGRESS | COMPLETED

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportPlan.LastAttemptedExecutionTime
member.summary:

The date and time that a report job associated with this report plan last attempted to run, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of LastAttemptedExecutionTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportPlan.LastSuccessfulExecutionTime
member.summary:

The date and time that a report job associated with this report plan last successfully ran, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of LastSuccessfulExecutionTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportPlan.ReportDeliveryChannel

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportPlan.ReportPlanArn
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportPlan.ReportPlanName
member.summary:

The unique name of the report plan. This name is between 1 and 256 characters starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.ReportPlan.ReportSetting
member.summary:

Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using a report template. The report templates are:

If the report template is RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT or CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT, this API resource also describes the report coverage by Amazon Web Services Regions and frameworks.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartBackupJobRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the StartBackupJob operation. Starts an on-demand backup job for the specified resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartBackupJobRequest.BackupOptions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupOptions.
Specifies the backup option for a selected resource. This option is only available for Windows Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS) backup jobs.
Valid values: Set to "WindowsVSS":"enabled" to enable the WindowsVSS backup option and create a Windows VSS backup. Set to "WindowsVSS""disabled" to create a regular backup. The WindowsVSS option is not enabled by default.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartBackupJobRequest.BackupVaultName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupVaultName.
The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartBackupJobRequest.CompleteWindowMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CompleteWindowMinutes.
A value in minutes during which a successfully started backup must complete, or else AWS Backup will cancel the job. This value is optional. This value begins counting down from when the backup was scheduled. It does not add additional time for StartWindowMinutes, or if the backup started later than scheduled.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartBackupJobRequest.IamRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IamRoleArn.
Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point; for example, arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartBackupJobRequest.IdempotencyToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdempotencyToken.
A customer-chosen string that you can use to distinguish between otherwise identical calls to StartBackupJob. Retrying a successful request with the same idempotency token results in a success message with no action taken.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartBackupJobRequest.Lifecycle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Lifecycle.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup will transition and expire backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold storage.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartBackupJobRequest.RecoveryPointTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecoveryPointTags.
To help organize your resources, you can assign your own metadata to the resources that you create. Each tag is a key-value pair.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartBackupJobRequest.ResourceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceArn.
An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartBackupJobRequest.StartWindowMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartWindowMinutes.
A value in minutes after a backup is scheduled before a job will be canceled if it doesn't start successfully. This value is optional, and the default is 8 hours.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartRestoreJobRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the StartRestoreJob operation. Recovers the saved resource identified by an Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartRestoreJobRequest.IamRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IamRoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that Backup uses to create the target recovery point; for example, arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartRestoreJobRequest.IdempotencyToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdempotencyToken.
A customer-chosen string that you can use to distinguish between otherwise identical calls to StartRestoreJob. Retrying a successful request with the same idempotency token results in a success message with no action taken.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartRestoreJobRequest.Metadata
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Metadata.
A set of metadata key-value pairs. Contains information, such as a resource name, required to restore a recovery point.
You can get configuration metadata about a resource at the time it was backed up by calling GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata. However, values in addition to those provided by GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata might be required to restore a resource. For example, you might need to provide a new resource name if the original already exists.
You need to specify specific metadata to restore an Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) instance:
file-system-id: The ID of the Amazon EFS file system that is backed up by Backup. Returned in GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata.
Encrypted: A Boolean value that, if true, specifies that the file system is encrypted. If KmsKeyId is specified, Encrypted must be set to true.
KmsKeyId: Specifies the Amazon Web Services KMS key that is used to encrypt the restored file system. You can specify a key from another Amazon Web Services account provided that key it is properly shared with your account via Amazon Web Services KMS.
PerformanceMode: Specifies the throughput mode of the file system.
CreationToken: A user-supplied value that ensures the uniqueness (idempotency) of the request.
newFileSystem: A Boolean value that, if true, specifies that the recovery point is restored to a new Amazon EFS file system.
ItemsToRestore: An array of one to five strings where each string is a file path. Use ItemsToRestore to restore specific files or directories rather than the entire file system. This parameter is optional. For example, "itemsToRestore":"[\"/my.test\"]".

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartRestoreJobRequest.RecoveryPointArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecoveryPointArn.
An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.StartRestoreJobRequest.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
Starts a job to restore a recovery point for one of the following resources:
DynamoDB for Amazon DynamoDB
EBS for Amazon Elastic Block Store
EC2 for Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud
EFS for Amazon Elastic File System
RDS for Amazon Relational Database Service
Aurora for Amazon Aurora
Storage Gateway for Storage Gateway

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateBackupPlanRequest

member.summary:

Specifies the body of a backup plan. Includes a BackupPlanName and one or more sets of Rules.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateBackupPlanRequest.BackupPlanId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupPlanId.
Uniquely identifies a backup plan.

Contains a list of BackupOptions for each resource type.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateBackupPlanResponse.BackupPlanArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupPlanArn.
An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup plan; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:plan:8F81F553-3A74-4A3F-B93D-B3360DC80C50.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateBackupPlanResponse.BackupPlanId

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateBackupPlanResponse.CreationDate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationDate.
The date and time a backup plan is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateBackupPlanResponse.VersionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VersionId.
Unique, randomly generated, Unicode, UTF-8 encoded strings that are at most 1,024 bytes long. Version Ids cannot be edited.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateGlobalSettingsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateGlobalSettings operation. Updates whether the Amazon Web Services account is opted in to cross-account backup. Returns an error if the account is not an Organizations management account. Use the DescribeGlobalSettings API to determine the current settings.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateGlobalSettingsRequest.GlobalSettings
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GlobalSettings.
A value for isCrossAccountBackupEnabled and a Region. Example: update-global-settings --global-settings isCrossAccountBackupEnabled=false --region us-west-2.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateGlobalSettingsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateGlobalSettings operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle operation. Sets the transition lifecycle of a recovery point.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold storage.
Does not support continuous backups.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleRequest.BackupVaultName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupVaultName.
The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the Amazon Web Services Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleRequest.Lifecycle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Lifecycle.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleRequest.RecoveryPointArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecoveryPointArn.
An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleResponse.BackupVaultArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BackupVaultArn.
An ARN that uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleResponse.CalculatedLifecycle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CalculatedLifecycle.
A CalculatedLifecycle object containing DeleteAt and MoveToColdStorageAt timestamps.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleResponse.Lifecycle
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Lifecycle.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold storage.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleResponse.RecoveryPointArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecoveryPointArn.
An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRegionSettingsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateRegionSettings operation. Updates the current service opt-in settings for the Region. If service-opt-in is enabled for a service, Backup tries to protect that service's resources in this Region, when the resource is included in an on-demand backup or scheduled backup plan. Otherwise, Backup does not try to protect that service's resources in this Region. Use the DescribeRegionSettings API to determine the resource types that are supported.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRegionSettingsRequest.ResourceTypeOptInPreference
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceTypeOptInPreference.
Updates the list of services along with the opt-in preferences for the Region.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRegionSettingsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateRegionSettings operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateReportPlanRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateReportPlan operation. Updates an existing report plan identified by its ReportPlanName with the input document in JSON format.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateReportPlanRequest.IdempotencyToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdempotencyToken.
A customer-chosen string that you can use to distinguish between otherwise identical calls to UpdateReportPlanInput. Retrying a successful request with the same idempotency token results in a success message with no action taken.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateReportPlanRequest.ReportDeliveryChannel
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportDeliveryChannel.
A structure that contains information about where to deliver your reports, specifically your Amazon S3 bucket name, S3 key prefix, and the formats of your reports.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateReportPlanRequest.ReportPlanDescription
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportPlanDescription.
An optional description of the report plan with a maximum 1,024 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateReportPlanRequest.ReportPlanName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportPlanName.
The unique name of the report plan. This name is between 1 and 256 characters, starting with a letter, and consisting of letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), and underscores (_).

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateReportPlanRequest.ReportSetting
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportSetting.
Identifies the report template for the report. Reports are built using a report template. The report templates are:
RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT | BACKUP_JOB_REPORT | COPY_JOB_REPORT | RESTORE_JOB_REPORT
If the report template is RESOURCE_COMPLIANCE_REPORT or CONTROL_COMPLIANCE_REPORT, this API resource also describes the report coverage by Amazon Web Services Regions and frameworks.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateReportPlanResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateReportPlan operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateReportPlanResponse.CreationTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationTime.
The date and time that a report plan is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateReportPlanResponse.ReportPlanArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportPlanArn.
An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateReportPlanResponse.ReportPlanName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportPlanName.
The unique name of the report plan.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing Backup
Backup
Backup is a unified backup service designed to protect Amazon Web Services services and their associated data. Backup simplifies the creation, migration, restoration, and deletion of backups, while also providing reporting and auditing.

member.name: P:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.Paginators
member.summary: Paginators for the service

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonBackupClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.CreateBackupPlan(Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateBackupPlanRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a backup plan using a backup plan name and backup rules. A backup plan is a document that contains information that Backup uses to schedule tasks that create recovery points for resources.
If you call CreateBackupPlan with a plan that already exists, you receive an AlreadyExistsException exception.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateBackupPlan service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateBackupPlan service method, as returned by Backup.
member.exception: The required resource already exists.
Indicates that something is wrong with a parameter's value. For example, the value is out of range.
A limit in the request has been exceeded; for example, a maximum number of items allowed in a request.
Indicates that a required parameter is missing.
The request failed due to a temporary failure of the server.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateBackupPlan Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.CreateBackupSelection(Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateBackupSelectionRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a JSON document that specifies a set of resources to assign to a backup plan. Resources can be included by specifying patterns for a ListOfTags and selected Resources.
For example, consider the following patterns:
Resources: "arn:aws:ec2:region:account-id:volume/volume-id"
ConditionKey:"department"
ConditionValue:"finance"
ConditionType:"StringEquals"
ConditionKey:"importance"
ConditionValue:"critical"
ConditionType:"StringEquals"
Using these patterns would back up all Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volumes that are tagged as "department=finance", "importance=critical", in addition to an EBS volume with the specified volume ID.
Resources and conditions are additive in that all resources that match the pattern are selected. This shouldn't be confused with a logical AND, where all conditions must match. The matching patterns are logically put together using the OR operator. In other words, all patterns that match are selected for backup.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateBackupSelection service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateBackupSelection service method, as returned by Backup.
member.exception: The required resource already exists.
Indicates that something is wrong with a parameter's value. For example, the value is out of range.
A limit in the request has been exceeded; for example, a maximum number of items allowed in a request.
Indicates that a required parameter is missing.
The request failed due to a temporary failure of the server.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateBackupSelection Operation

Using these patterns would back up all Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volumes that are tagged as "department=finance", "importance=critical", in addition to an EBS volume with the specified volume ID.

The matching patterns are logically put together using the OR operator. In other words, all patterns that match are selected for backup.

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.CreateBackupVault(Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateBackupVaultRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a logical container where backups are stored. A CreateBackupVault request includes a name, optionally one or more resource tags, an encryption key, and a request ID.
Do not include sensitive data, such as passport numbers, in the name of a backup vault.

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.CreateFramework(Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateFrameworkRequest)
member.summary: Creates a framework with one or more controls. A framework is a collection of controls that you can use to evaluate your backup practices. member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.DeleteBackupPlan(Amazon.Backup.Model.DeleteBackupPlanRequest)

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.DisassociateRecoveryPoint(Amazon.Backup.Model.DisassociateRecoveryPointRequest)
member.summary:
Deletes the specified continuous backup recovery point from Backup and releases control of that continuous backup to the source service, such as Amazon RDS. The source service will continue to create and retain continuous backups using the lifecycle that you specified in your original backup plan.
Does not support snapshot backup recovery points.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DisassociateRecoveryPoint service method.
member.returns: The response from the DisassociateRecoveryPoint service method, as returned by Backup.

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration(Amazon.Backup.Model.PutBackupVaultLockConfigurationRequest)
member.summary: Applies Backup Vault Lock to a backup vault, preventing attempts to delete any recovery point stored in or created in a backup vault. Vault Lock also prevents attempts to update the lifecycle policy that controls the retention period of any recovery point currently stored in a backup vault. If specified, Vault Lock enforces a minimum and maximum retention period for future backup and copy jobs that target a backup vault.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the PutBackupVaultLockConfiguration service method.

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle(Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleRequest)
member.summary:
Sets the transition lifecycle of a recovery point.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold storage.
Does not support continuous backups.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle service method.
member.returns: The response from the UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle service method, as returned by Backup.
member.exception: Indicates that something is wrong with a parameter's value. For example, the value is out of range.
Indicates that a required parameter is missing.
A resource that is required for the action doesn't exist.
The request failed due to a temporary failure of the server.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.AmazonBackupClient.UpdateRegionSettings(Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRegionSettingsRequest)
member.summary: Updates the current service opt-in settings for the Region. If service-opt-in is enabled for a service, Backup tries to protect that service's resources in this Region, when the resource is included in an on-demand backup or scheduled backup plan. Otherwise, Backup does not try to protect that service's resources in this Region. Use the DescribeRegionSettings API to determine the resource types that are supported.

member.name: T:Amazon.Backup.IAmazonBackup
member.summary:
Interface for accessing Backup
Backup
Backup is a unified backup service designed to protect Amazon Web Services services and their associated data. Backup simplifies the creation, migration, restoration, and deletion of backups, while also providing reporting and auditing.

Creates a backup plan using a backup plan name and backup rules. A backup plan is a document that contains information that Backup uses to schedule tasks that create recovery points for resources.
If you call CreateBackupPlan with a plan that already exists, you receive an AlreadyExistsException exception.

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.IAmazonBackup.CreateBackupSelection(Amazon.Backup.Model.CreateBackupSelectionRequest)
member.summary:
Creates a JSON document that specifies a set of resources to assign to a backup plan. Resources can be included by specifying patterns for a ListOfTags and selected Resources.
For example, consider the following patterns:
Resources: "arn:aws:ec2:region:account-id:volume/volume-id"
ConditionKey:"department"
ConditionValue:"finance"
ConditionType:"StringEquals"
ConditionKey:"importance"
ConditionValue:"critical"
ConditionType:"StringEquals"
Using these patterns would back up all Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volumes that are tagged as "department=finance", "importance=critical", in addition to an EBS volume with the specified volume ID.
Resources and conditions are additive in that all resources that match the pattern are selected. This shouldn't be confused with a logical AND, where all conditions must match. The matching patterns are logically put together using the OR operator. In other words, all patterns that match are selected for backup.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateBackupSelection service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateBackupSelection service method, as returned by Backup.
member.exception: The required resource already exists.
Indicates that something is wrong with a parameter's value. For example, the value is out of range.
A limit in the request has been exceeded; for example, a maximum number of items allowed in a request.
Indicates that a required parameter is missing.
The request failed due to a temporary failure of the server.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateBackupSelection Operation

The matching patterns are logically put together using the OR operator. In other words, all patterns that match are selected for backup.

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.IAmazonBackup.DisassociateRecoveryPoint(Amazon.Backup.Model.DisassociateRecoveryPointRequest)
member.summary:

Does not support snapshot backup recovery points.

member.summary: Applies Backup Vault Lock to a backup vault, preventing attempts to delete any recovery point stored in or created in a backup vault. Vault Lock also prevents attempts to update the lifecycle policy that controls the retention period of any recovery point currently stored in a backup vault. member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.IAmazonBackup.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle(Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycleRequest)
member.summary:
Sets the transition lifecycle of a recovery point.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold storage.
Does not support continuous backups.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle service method.
member.returns: The response from the UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle service method, as returned by Backup.
member.exception: Indicates that something is wrong with a parameter's value. For example, the value is out of range.
Indicates that a required parameter is missing.
A resource that is required for the action doesn't exist.
The request failed due to a temporary failure of the server.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle Operation

member.summary:
Sets the transition lifecycle of a recovery point.
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.
Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.
Only Amazon EFS file system backups can be transitioned to cold storage.
Does not support continuous backups.

member.name: M:Amazon.Backup.IAmazonBackup.UpdateRegionSettings(Amazon.Backup.Model.UpdateRegionSettingsRequest)
member.summary: Updates the current service opt-in settings for the Region. If service-opt-in is enabled for a service, Backup tries to protect that service's resources in this Region, when the resource is included in an on-demand backup or scheduled backup plan. Otherwise, Backup does not try to protect that service's resources in this Region. Use the DescribeRegionSettings API to determine the resource types that are supported.
